channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report E-2023080170
item.description:
Report E-2023080170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BRAINTREE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XEE experienced a UN1993 Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 release from a 300-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to a bad weld on the tote. Contractors transferred the product from the damaged tote into a new 275-gallon poly tote and 55-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All waste was collected into a separate 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023080026
item.description:
Report I-2023080026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE UNLOADER WAS UNLOADING WHEN HE CAME UPON A PACKAGE WITH A STRONG ODOR AND LIQUD COMING OUT AT THE CORNER OF THE BOX. THE UNLOADER THEN LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLOWING THE DESICION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTER PROCESSING. THEN DETERMINED TO BE UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2023080308
item.description:
Report X-2023080308

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: NATICK
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When unloading the hazmat, the package handler heard the glass shift and notified a manager immediately. The hazmat was then placed into a red hazmat bin and placed in the hazmat cage under the ventilation fan. DescribePack: The hazmat was wrapped in bubble wrap with little packing paper inside the box, leaving gaps inside the box for the hazmat to move around. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed inside a red hazmat bin and taken to the hazmat cage, placed under the vent.
